articles.headline: South and West See Large Gains in Latest Census
articles.snippet: An announcement of the first census result marked the start of a season of redistricting that will increase the power of the South and West in Congress.
articles.abstract: An announcement of the first census result marked the start of a season of redistricting that will increase the power of the South and West in Congress.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Census Bureau rearranged the country’s political map on Tuesday, giving more Congressional seats to the South and the West at the expense of the Northeast and the Midwest  changes that will have far-reaching implications for elections over the next decade.
articles.byline: By Sabrina Tavernise and Jeff Zeleny

articles.headline: Arms Treaty With Russia Headed for Ratification
articles.snippet: The New Start treaty with Russia cleared a hurdle in the Senate with the help of 11 G.O.P. votes and seemed headed for near-certain ratification on Wednesday.
articles.abstract: The New Start treaty with Russia cleared a hurdle in the Senate with the help of 11 G.O.P. votes and seemed headed for near-certain ratification on Wednesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  An arms control treaty paring back American and Russian nuclear arsenals won a decisive vote in the Senate on Tuesday, clearing it for final approval and handing President Obama an important foreign policy victory.

articles.headline: E.E.O.C. Sues Kaplan Over Hiring
articles.snippet: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission wants to stop Kaplan’s use of credit histories in job offers.
articles.abstract: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission wants to stop Kaplan’s use of credit histories in job offers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sending a sharp warning to employers nationwide, the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission sued the Kaplan Higher Education Corporation on Tuesday, accusing it of discriminating against black job applicants through the way it uses credit histories in its hiring process.

articles.headline: House Passes Overhaul of Food Laws
articles.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration will be able to order a recall rather than relying on the cooperation of the company.
articles.abstract: The Food and Drug Administration will be able to order a recall rather than relying on the cooperation of the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: The House of Representatives gave final approval on Tuesday to a long-awaited modernization of the nation’s food safety laws, voting 215 to 144 to grant the Food and Drug Administration greater authority over food production.

articles.headline: In a Sign of Foreclosure Flaws, Suits Claim Break-Ins by Banks
articles.snippet: Critics said a tide of lawsuits accusing banks of wrongfully breaking into homes reinforced their claim that the foreclosure process is fundamentally flawed.
articles.abstract: Critics said a tide of lawsuits accusing banks of wrongfully breaking into homes reinforced their claim that the foreclosure process is fundamentally flawed.
articles.lead_paragraph: TRUCKEE, Calif.  When Mimi Ash arrived at her mountain chalet here for a weekend ski trip, she discovered that someone had broken into the home and changed the locks.

articles.headline: Obama Nuclear Agenda Only Gets Harder After Treaty
articles.snippet: The battle over ratification of the arms control treaty with Russia has shown a growing political divide on national security.
articles.abstract: The battle over ratification of the arms control treaty with Russia has shown a growing political divide on national security.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The new arms control treaty with Russia, whose ratification now seems assured, was initially envisioned as a speed bump on President Obama’s nuclear agenda, a modest reduction in nuclear forces that would enable him to tackle much harder issues on the way to his dream of eventually eliminating nuclear weapons altogether.

articles.headline: A Tough Sell at Sears
articles.snippet: Sales at Sears are worse than at its major competitors, and many of the company’s 2,200 Sears and Kmart stores are run-down and in undesirable locations.
articles.abstract: Sales at Sears are worse than at its major competitors, and many of the company’s 2,200 Sears and Kmart stores are run-down and in undesirable locations.
articles.lead_paragraph: This holiday season, Sears and Kmart, which merged in 2005, are pushing a single message: Buy with layaway, buy with coupons, buy now and pay later, buy with loyalty rewards points  but please, just buy.

articles.headline: African Farmers Displaced as Investors Move In
articles.snippet: Across Africa and the developing world, a new global land rush is gobbling up large expanses of arable land.
articles.abstract: Across Africa and the developing world, a new global land rush is gobbling up large expanses of arable land.
articles.lead_paragraph: SOUMOUNI, Mali — The half-dozen strangers who descended on this remote West African village brought its hand-to-mouth farmers alarming news: their humble fields, tilled from one generation to the next, were now controlled by Libya’s leader, Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, and the farmers would all have to leave.
